content: Online newspaper archive of Singapore **NewspaperSG** is an online newspaper archive launched in 2010 containing newspapers distributed in Singapore, including those published in the 19th century. ## History The [National Library Board](/wiki/National_Library_Board) and [Singapore Press Holdings](/wiki/Singapore_Press_Holdings) signed an agreement in 2007 to make digitised articles of *[The Straits Times](/wiki/The_Straits_Times)* available for public access at NLB libraries. NewspaperSG was launched on 28 January 2010. At the archive's launch, it included 14 newspapers, including the *[New Nation](/wiki/New_Nation_(Singapore))*, *[Sin Chew Jit Poh](/wiki/Sin_Chew_Jit_Poh_(Singapore))*, *[Nanyang Siang Pau](/wiki/Nanyang_Siang_Pau_(Singapore))*, *[Berita Harian](/wiki/Berita_Harian_(Singapore))*, the *Singapore Weekly Herald*, the *Straits Mail*, *[The Business Times](/wiki/Business_Times_(Singapore))*, *[today](/wiki/Today_(Singapore_newspaper))*, *[Streats](/wiki/Streats)*, the *Malayan Saturday Post*, the *Straits Observer*, and the *Straits Telegraph and Daily Advertiser*. In December 2017, six more newspapers were added to the archive, the *[Syonan Shimbun](/wiki/Syonan_Shimbun)*, *Comrade*, the *[Indian Daily Mail](/wiki/Indian_Daily_Mail)*, the *[Malaya Tribune](/wiki/Malaya_Tribune)*, the *[Morning Tribune](/wiki/Morning_Tribune)*, and the *Sunday Tribune* bringing the number of newspapers on the site to 41. - Official website
title: NewspaperSG
